titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Episcopal Church, Diocese of Wyoming, 1883-2005
titlestmt.author: Processed by Laura Jackson

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Jackson September 2010

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Episcopal Church. Diocese of Wyoming records

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, office files, publications, and photographs documenting the administration, management, activities, and work of the Episcopal Church in Wyoming.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in fourteen series. The first seven series are organized by Bishop in chronological order.

bioghist.head: History of the Episcopal Church. Diocese of Wyoming.
bioghist.p: The Episcopal Church has been in the state of Wyoming since 1856, being included in a missionary district with Colorado, Idaho, Nebraska and the Dakotas since 1859. The Missionary District of Idaho and Wyoming was created by the General Convention of October 1886. The Episcopal Church Diocese of Wyoming was established in 1896 by the Episcopal Missionary Board. By 2010, there were over 7,000 Episcopalians in Wyoming.

Bishops of the Diocese of Wyoming were: Ethelbert Talbot (1887-1896); Nathaniel S. Thomas (1909-1927); Elmer N. Schmuck (1929-1936); Winfred H. Ziegler (1936-1949); James W. Hunter (1949-1969, deceased 1987); David R. Thornberry (1969-1977, deceased 1995); Bob G. Jones (1977-1996); Bruce Caldwell (1997-2010), and John Smylie (2010-).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Episcopal Church of Wyoming collection contains the general office records of the church from 1909-2002. General office records (found in Series I through VII) largely contain correspondence documenting finances, individual churches, schools, hospitals, convocations, conventions, Board of Trustees, committees, councils, clergy, staff, and congregation. The collection also has publications, photographs, remarriage and personnel records (restriction applies), and records of the Standing Committee (restriction applies). This collection documents many aspects of the Episcopal Church in Wyoming, including the Cathedral Home for Children in Laramie, WY; Episcopal Church Women; missionary work on Wyoming Indian reservations; the Domestic and Foreign Missionary Society; and KFBU Radio Station.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Class A Restricted Records (found in Series XII, XIII, and XIV) are any records clearly identified as relating to a) Diocesan personnel, including but not limited to priests; b) remarriage files; c) the Standing Committee; d) the Commission on Ministry. Diocese hereby reserves any copyrights it possesses in and the right to control access to Class A Restricted Records which by their year date are less than seventy (70) years old. Center shall only allow access to and use of Class A Restricted Records by other persons approved in writing by Diocese. Boxes restricted under this clause: 101-118, 179; Boxes containing folders restricted under this clause: 192

Class B Restricted Records (found in Series V, VI, VII, and VIII) are defined as the class of Diocesan Office records. Diocese hereby reserves any copyrights it possesses in and the right to control access to Class B Restricted Records which by their year date are less than thirty (30) years old or until the death of the respective Bishop, whichever occurs later. Center shall only allow access to and use of Class B Restricted Records by other persons approved in writing by Diocese. Boxes restricted under this clause: 127-144, 147-150, 157, 158, 170, 193. Boxes containing folders restricted under this clause: 124-126, 146, 151, 152.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Persons granted access by Diocese to restricted records, Class A and B, may quote or publish from the records under the fair use provision of the copyright law. For quotation or publication beyond the fair use provision of the copyright law, written approval of Diocese must be secured by said persons prior to such quotation or publication.
The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Episcopal Church. Diocese of Wyoming at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was received from the Episcopal Church, Diocese of Wyoming in 1967 and 2008.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Laura Uglean Jackson, September 2010

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.

did.unittitle: Series I. Bishop Nathaniel S. Thomas Diocesan Office Records

scopecontent.p: Records within this series consist almost entirely of correspondence to or from Bishop Thomas covering the general administration and management of the Diocese of Wyoming.. See sub-series descriptions for more detailed information. All dates are approximate.

This sub-series contains correspondence arranged mostly alphabetically. Correspondence can also be found in sub-series 2 and 3 with the general office records. Materials in this sub-series were originally part of an earlier accretion.

did.unittitle: Laramie, Wyoming - Cathedral School for Girls

scopecontent.p: Consists almost entirely of correspondence with clergy and other personnel and covering a range of topics. There is also some printed material. Materials in this sub-series were originally part of an earlier accretion.

did.unittitle: Corbett, Rev. A (Pinedale, Rock Springs, Eden Valley)
Fort Laramie Project- Report of Harry Crain
Fort Laramie Project- Report of William Dubois with Photographs
Fort Laramie Project- Report of Robert Toole
Sermon- Lawful and Unlawful Use of Law

scopecontent.p: Contains mostly correspondence with clergy and other personnel on topics such as contributions, financial transactions, convocations, staffing decisions, special projects and events, Sons of the Revolution, committees, and the general administration and management of the Diocese of Wyoming. Also includes correspondence and financial data on individual churches in Wyoming. All dates are approximate.

did.unittitle: Bishop Randall Hospital Board of Directors Minutes
Series II. Bishop Elmer N. Schmuck Diocesan Office Records and Personal Records

scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence primarily to and from Bishop Schmuck with clergy and other church personnel covering the general administration and management of the Diocese of Wyoming. Topics include finances, properties, special projects, councils, churches, Cathedral Home, Board of Trustees, and many other topics.

did.unittitle: Correspondence (prior to becoming Bishop of Wyoming)
Series III. Bishop Winfred H. Ziegler Diocesan Office Records

scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence primarily to or from Bishop Ziegler with clergy and other church personnel covering the general administration and management of the Diocese of Wyoming. Topics include, but are not limited to, finances, clergy, individual churches, Cathedral Home, National Council, publications, convocations, trustees, and Bishop Randall Hospital.

did.unittitle: Records created during transition period from Schmuck to Ziegler
Series IV. Bishop James W. Hunter Office Records

scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence primarily to or from Bishop Hunter with clergy and other church personnel covering the general administration and management of the Diocese of Wyoming. Topics include, but are not limited to, finances, clergy, individual churches, Cathedral Home, and National Council.

did.unittitle: Series V. Bishops James W. Hunter, David R. Thornberry and Bob G. Jones Diocesan Office Records

scopecontent.p: Some folders in this series are RESTRICTED, see restriction note for Class B Restricted Records (above) for details. RESTRICTED FOLDERS ARE MARKED WITH A BLACK STICKER. Restricted folders have the most recent date of material within the folder noted on them.

This series contains a set of office files spanning the terms of three bishops. Topics include the Board of Trustees, Convention of the Diocese; Diocesan and Executive Councils; and Indian Work. Files in this series may contain correspondence, notes, plans, accounting records, speeches, and other types of materials. Also included are the reading files of Bishop Thornberry, unrestricted.

did.unittitle: Series VI. Bishop Bob G. Jones Office Records

scopecontent.p: RESTRICTED: As of September 2010, all materials in this series are restricted. See restriction note for Class B Restricted Records (above) for details.

Because of the restriction, this series is not arranged in any particular order. Approximate date range given for each box so that researchers can better access some materials as the restriction is lifted. Reading files contain correspondence.

did.unittitle: RESTRICTED- Churches in Wyoming by location
RESTRICTED- Bishop's and Others' Reading Files
RESTRICTED- Bishop's and Others' Reading Files
RESTRICTED- Bishop's and Others' Reading Files
Series VII. Bishops Bob G. Jones and Bruce Caldwell Diocesan Office Records

scopecontent.p: RESTRICTED: As of September 2010, all materials in this series are restricted. See restriction note for Class B Records (above) for details.
This series contains office files spanning the terms of Bishops Jones and Caldwell.
Folders with materials dating after 1977 are RESTRICTED. See restriction note for Class B Restricted Records (above) for details. RESTRICTED FOLDERS ARE MARKED WITH A BLACK STICKER.

This series contains material that was not originally arranged with the Bishops' General Office Files and sets of records that span across several Bishops. It includes information on groups and committees within the Church, schools and hospitals run by the Church, events, historical and informational accounts, confirmations and baptisms, and the KFBU Radio Station. Materials include registers, policies, printed information, scrapbooks, correspondence, financial records, and a variety of other materials. The Episcopal Church Women material contains audio tapes. Many of the topics in this series can also be found in the Bishops' General Office Records.

scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence and other information about individual churches in Wyoming. Churches are arranged by town/city. Similar materials can also be found in the Bishops' office files series.

Contains newsletters and other publications covering activities, news, information, and meetings of the Episcopal Church of Wyoming. Includes individual written histories of some churches in Wyoming. There are also pamphlets and other publications from the national level.

did.unittitle: Journal of Annual Conventions/ Missionary District of Wyoming Journal of Convocation
Journal of Annual Conventions/ Missionary District of Wyoming Journal of Convocation
Journal of Annual Conventions/ Missionary District of Wyoming Journal of Convocation

scopecontent.p: Contains photographs, negatives, slides, and videocassettes of clergy, church activities, churches and towns, unidentified individuals, ranches, and schools. Also includes transparencies of a presentation on growing the membership.

scopecontent.p: RESTRICTED- Materials in this series are restricted for 70 years from their creation date. See restriction note for Class A Restricted Records (above) for details. Box #181 is unrestricted. Includes meeting minutes and correspondence.
